frameDefinitions: In this frame, a Communicator judges the Addressee and then communicates that appraisal directly to the Addressee.
The words in this frame have to do with people and the personal Relationships they are or can be a part of.
A Current_instance of a certain Type is under discussion.
A Speaker warns an Addressee by giving a Message that describes an undesirable situation that may affect the Addressee.
A Speaker addresses an Addressee with a Message, which may be indirectly referred to as a Topic.
frameExamples: The principal <t>rebuked</t> the student for cheating on the exam.
And of course that drippy <t><fex name='Partner_1'>boyfriend</fex></t> of hers backed her up.
The dog went that <t>way</t>towards the ice cream factory.
Kim has a <t>different</t> hair color every week
Jackson <t>warned</t> me that the weather could change quickly, but I guess I didn't really believe him.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Communicator</fen> communicates a judgment to the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The <fen>Addressee</fen> is jduged by the <fen>Communicator</fen> and receives the message of approval or disapproval.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject on which the <fen>Addressee</fen> is being judged.
The <fen>Reason</fen> is why the Communicator forms the type of judgment they form.
The <fen>Medium</fen> identifies the physical or abstract entity in which the judgment is conveyed.
An action or entity under the control of the <fen>Communicator</fen> that expresses the criticism or praise directed towards the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The point in time at which the <fen>Communicator</fen> berates or compliments the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Communicator</fen> admonishes the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
That partner in the <fen>Relationship</fen> who is realized as the subject of verbs in active form sentences, or of adjectives in predicative uses.
That partner in the <fen>Relationship</fen> who is not expressed as the external argument.
The joint construal of both <fen>Partners</fen> in the <fen>Relationship</fen>.
The <fen>Theme</fen> is the entity that traverses the trajectory.
The <fen>Source</fen> profiles the region where the <fen>Theme</fen> has travelled from (i.e. the region where the <fen>Theme</fen>'s movement began).

The <fen>Path</fen> is the region upon which the <fen>Theme</fen> travels. It is any region in between the <fen>Source</fen> (where the <fen>Theme</fen> departed from) and the <fen>Goal</fen> (where the theme will eventually arrive).
The <fen>Goal</fen> profiles the region at the end of the <fen>Theme</fen>'s <fen>Path</fen>. This is the region where the <fen>Theme</fen> movement stops.
The kind of thing of which instances are under discussion.
The instance of the <fen>Type</fen> that is currently under discussion.
An instance of the <fen>Type</fen> that was encountered previously and which is now compared for identity with the <fen>Current_instance</fen>.
The situation in which another instance of the <fen>Type</fen> was encountered earlier.
The complete set of instances of the <fen>Type</fen> involved in the mentioned contexts.
The Time when the Current_instance is the same or different.
The <fen>Speaker</fen> produces the <fen>Message</fen> to alert the <fen>Addressee</fen> as to possible danger.
The <fen>Addressee</fen> receives the warning from the <fen>Speaker</fen>.
The <fen>Message</fen> is the communication produced by the <fen>Speaker</fen>.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is a general description of the content of the <fen>Message</fen>.
This frame element is the <fen>Medium</fen> in which the <fen>Message</fen> is expressed.
The time period during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> warns the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The location in which the <fen>Speaker</fen> warns <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity that produces the <fen>Message</fen>.
The <fen>Addressee</fen> receives the <fen>Message</fen> from the <fen>Speaker</fen>.
The <fen>Message</fen> is the communication produced by the <fen>Speaker</fen>.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is a general description of the content of the <fen>Message</fen>.
This role is the <fen>Medium</fen> in which the <fen>Message</fen> is expressed.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> informs the <fen>Addressee</fen> of the <fen>Message</fen>.
<fen>Place</fen> is the location in which the <fen>Speaker</fen> informs  the <fen>Addressee</fen> of the <fen>Message</fen>.
listRoleExamples: The teacher scolded the children <fex>about their meessy cookie eating</fex>.
The principal rebuked the student <fex>for cheating on the exam</fex>.
Though she had killed him so long ago, she could still see his jeering <fex>smile</fex>.
She complimented me <fex>almost every morning</fex> on my smart starched shirts.
We were scolded <fex>in the kitchen</fex> by the biggest cook you've ever seen.
<fex>John</fex> is married to Sue.
John is <fex>Sue's</fex> husband.
<fex>John and Sue</fex> are married.
Smithers works in a different <fex>office</fex> now
This is a different car <fex>than last week</fex>
Kent Clark and Superman are the same person
<fex>Bill</fex> warned me that he would come to the party.
When did you warn <fex>everyone</fex> about the virus?
The authorities warned me <fex>that my brother had been arrested</fex>.
Leroy warned his coworkers <fex>about the upcoming audit</fex>.
The city will now warn residents <fex>in text messages and emails</fex>.
They warned me <fex>right away</fex> and everything worked out great.
She was warned about it <fex>in front of her family</fex>, but it seemed to have no effect.
<fex>Bill</fex> told me that he would come to the party.
The authorities informed me <fex>that my brother had been arrested</fex>.
Leroy told his mother <fex>about his arrest</fex>.

Even when we had a size problem they informed me <fex>right away</fex> and everything worked
out great.
She looked at it for a few moments, thinking of Mark Smeaton and what he had told her <fex>on the steps of City Hall</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the United Nations' Independent International Commission of Inquiry
The Syrian Observatory for Human Rights
